subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... That s not true. Even in Sun s libraries, there are public classes and methods in com.sun packages, which per convention aren t *published*. If you use
messageBody:
> in Java
> everything that's public is published, whether you want it to be or
> not.

That's not true. Even in Sun's libraries, there are public classes and
methods in com.sun packages, which per convention aren't *published*. If you
use them, you do so at your own peril.

You simply have to find conventions other than being public to mark
published API. In the project I'm currently working on, that wouldn't
suffice anyway, because we publish different APIs to different customers,
for example.

Cheers, Ilja
